Further to Chernihiv Oblast
Approaching Kyiv
2 Kinzhals in the airspace, entering Kyiv Oblast
2 Kinzhals in the airspace, entering Kyiv Oblast
Now over Zhytomyr Oblast. Flying one after another
Now over Zhytomyr Oblast. Flying one after another
Flying over Rivne Oblast towards Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast
Flying over Rivne Oblast towards Dobrotvir, Lviv Oblast
They will hit the power plant in Dobrotvir. Kh-101s hit it earlier
Explosions in Dobrotvir.

The missile attack is now over. More than 60 missiles of various types were used. I will publish a full report + the consequences later on. 
If you wish to support my work, you can do so here: 
https://buymeacoffee.com/amk_mapping
. 
Thank you for following along.

Last night, another large-scale, combined missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine: 
Missiles launched:
~25 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 7 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at the launch lines in Mokshansky District, Penza Oblast.
~7 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations northwest of Feodosia, Crimea.
~5 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK northeast of Simfereopol, Crimea.
~3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations near Taganrog, Rostov Oblast. 
~6 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Admiral Makarov" frigate.
~6 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Admiral Essen" frigate.
~4 Kinzhal aeroballistic hypersonic missiles launched from 4 MiG-31Ks at the launch lines in Rasskazovsky District, Tambov Oblast.
~2 Kinzhal aeroballistic hypersonic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31Ks at the launch lines in the area of Lipetsk City. 
~2 Kh-59 cruise missiles launched from 2 Su-34 fighters at the launch lines near Starobilsk, Luhansk Oblast.
~1 Kh-31P anti-radar missile launched from a Su-30SM fighter at the launch lines over the Black Sea west of Yevpatoriya, Crimea.
Interceptions rates are currently unknown but are very low. A minimum of 2 Kh-59s, 2 Kalibrs and 2 Kh-101s were shot down. 
The main targets for this strike were once again Ukrainian energy infrastructure. The following was hit:
Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Plant, Zaporizhzhia Oblast (47.86934, 35.08132) by ~8 Iskander-M ballistic missiles.
Unknown target in northern Zaporizhzhia City, Zaporizhzhia Oblast by ~5 Iskander-M ballistic missiles.
Unknown target in Dnipro, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast by 2 Iskander-Ms. 
Ladyzhyn Thermal Power Plant, Vinnytsia Oblast (48.70478, 29.22006) by ~2 Kinzhals, ~10 Kh-101s, and 2 Kalibrs. 
Dobrotvirska Thermal Power Plant, Lviv Oblast (50.21388, 24.37588) by ~2 Kinzhals and ~5 Kh-101s.
Burshtyn Thermal Power Plant, Ivano-Frankivak Oblast (49.20971, 24.66424) by ~3 Kh-101s and 2 Kalibrs.
Kalush Coal Power Plant, Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast (49.07006, 24.31860) by ~2 Kh-101s. 
Dashava Underground Gas Storage Facility, Lviv Oblast (49.40383, 23.89924) by ~2 Kalibrs.
Starokostyantyniv Airbase, Khmelnytskyi Oblast. (49.74558, 27.26758) by ~2 Kinzhals.
Dniester Hydroelectric Power Plant, Chernivtsi Oblast (48.59357, 27.45283) by ~4 Kh-101s.
Unknown target near Sarata, Odesa Oblast by 1 Kh-31P.
Additional places targeted by Geran-2 drones, but not by missiles, include:
Chernihiv City, Chernihiv Oblast.
Boryspil, Kyiv Oblast.
Krolevets, Sumy Oblast. 
Podilsk area, Odesa Oblast.
Kropyvnytskyi area, Kirovohrad Oblast.
Opishnia area, Poltava Oblast.
Kramatorsk area, Donetsk Oblast.
Oleksandrivka area, Donetsk Oblast.
Lubny area, Poltava Oblast.
Pryluky area, Chernihiv Oblast. 
Additionally, several Tornado-S rockets and KAB glide-bombs also impacted Zaporizhzhia City last night. 
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched are slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected was lower than actual launches.

A large fire is burning at the Burshtyn Thermal Power Plant in Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast after multiple Russian Kh-101 cruise missiles and more than 50 Geran-2 drones struck it. 
Electricity, heating, and water has been halted for the entire city of Burshtyn.
Footage showing one of the many Geran-2 drone strikes on the Ladyzhyn Thermal Power Plant in Vinnytsia Oblast. Several cruise missiles also struck it.
Scenes from the massive missile strike on Zaporizhzhia City. More than 45 missiles, drones, rockets, and KABs were used on targets in the city.
Scenes from the massive missile strike on Zaporizhzhia City. More than 45 missiles, drones, rockets, and KABs were used on targets in the city.
Last night, several Russian Geran-2 drones impacted Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv Oblast. NASA FIRMS data shows a large fire burning in the area of the hangars.
Last night, several Russian Geran-2 drones impacted Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv Oblast. NASA FIRMS data shows a large fire burning in the area of the hangars.

Emergency power outages have been implemented in several regions of Ukraine due to the massive Russian missile strikes tonight. 
Keep in mind, this is on top of the already scheduled rolling power outages currently in place for almost all regions.

Russian forces have captured the village of Vyshneve, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~926.
Total land area: ~1.94 km¬≤.

The Ukrainian soldiers still stationed and effectively encircled at the bottom of the Pokrovsk pocket in Lysivka and Sukhyi Yar remind me of those who were encircled in the industrial zones outside Avdiivka. 
Neither time were they given the order to withdraw in time, even though there were weeks of opportunities to do so. 
The Ukrainian command does not care about these soldiers and is happy to use them to delay the collapse of their PR cities for propaganda purposes. This is absolutely disgusting and should be a wakeup call for those who still think otherwise.

The next round of map updates will come tomorrow once I have the energy to post about it. I covered the missile attack for over 12 hours straight with no breaks today lol.
This means some of the info provided will be slightly delayed, but there will be a lot to talk about regarding Pokrovsk. It also means some of the other Ukraine-related news I planned to post about wont be covered today.

Over 130 Killed In Deadliest Police Raid In History Of Brazil (Videos)
Over 130 people, including several police officers, died in a massive raid by Brazilian security forces aimed at organized crime in Rio de Janeiro on October 28.
Rio de Janeiro State Governor Cl√°udio Castro told reporters at a press conference that police confiscated a ‚Äúlarge quantity of drugs‚Äù in the raid, according to Reuters. Authorities also claimed on social media that 81 people were arrested and at least 42 rifles were seized during the operation.
Castro went on to pronounce the raid ‚Äúthe biggest operation in the history of Rio de Janeiro‚Äù in a post to the X social network.

Situation Is ‚ÄòVery Negative‚Äô For Ukraine: Russian Forces Break Through Pokrovsk Line
Units of the ¬´Center¬ª group have taken control of the villages of Rog and Gnatovka, and are fighting for control of the industrial zone to the north of Pokrovsk. In Zaporizhzhia, the ¬´East¬ª grouping has seized control of the Vishnevoe area. 
The Ukrainian command is planning to withdraw its units from the Pokrovsk-Mirnograd district.

Kyiv Wants Land, Not People: Former US State Department Adviser Warns
James Carden, former US State Department Russia Policy Adviser has faced criticism in certain circles over his otherwise underreported comments during a recent¬†interview¬†to Australian Sky News ‚Äî especially for mentioning some hard truths about the ethnopolitics of Ukraine.
In that interview, Mr. Carden noted that, like HIMARS or F-16s, Tomahawks won‚Äôt be a gamechanger, and argued that Putin‚Äôs proposal ‚Äî EU but not NATO membership ‚Äî was a fair enough bargain.¬†When the host replied that, in this case, that would involve land concessions as part of a land-for-peace deal, the former State Department Adviser argued that the land Kyiv would be ceding is a land that: ‚Äúthey themselves have been attacking since 2014.¬†The Ukrainians are being a bit disingenuous here...¬†They claim to want the land in the Donbass, Eastern Ukraine.¬†But they don‚Äôt want the ethnic Russian citizens on that land.¬†

U.S. Will Build Nuclear Submarine For South Korea To Strangle Chinese Navy
United States President Donald Trump announced on October 30 that he had given South Korea approval to build a nuclear-powered submarine as a part of the new trade deal between the two countries.
The submarine will be built in a Philadelphia shipyard, where South Korean firms have increased investment, according to Trump.
‚ÄúSouth Korea will be building its Nuclear Powered Submarine in the Philadelphia Shipyards, right here in the good ol‚Äô U.S.A. Shipbuilding in our Country will soon be making a BIG COMEBACK,‚Äù Trump wrote on his Truth Social network.
On October 29, Trump announced that the U.S. and South Korea reached a trade deal in which South Korea would pay the U.S. $350 billion in exchange for lower tariffs. The president also said that South Korea agreed to purchase U.S. oil and gas in ‚Äúvast quantities.‚Äù

Russian Army Is Few Kilometers Away From Locking Up Pokrovsk, Securing Yanchur Line 
On October 30, the Russian military reached the northern outskirts of the city of Pokrovsk in Donetsk and captured another settlement along the Yanchur River in Zaporozhye.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces reached the northern outskirts of Pokrovsk in several areas after breaking through Ukrainian defenses in the center of the city. One of these areas is between the streets of Provulok Yakuba Kolasa and Vulytsya Zavods‚Äôka, close to the cemetery along the road leading to Dobropillia further to the north.
At the same time, the Tsentr Group of Forces advanced to the south of Rodynske, along Dobropillia road, approaching Pokrovsk.

Military Situation In Syria On October 30, 2025 (Map Update)

Russian Army Makes Breakthroughs In Kupyansk, Krasny Liman & Seversk
On October 30, the Russian military broke through Ukrainian defenses near the city of Kupyansk in Kharkiv, and moved closer to the cities of Krasny Liman and Seversk in Donetsk.
The Zapad [West] Group of Forces, which is already in control of most of Kupyansk, advanced to the south of the city and captured Sadove, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense.
The capture of Sadove made any attempt to reinforce or supply Ukrainian troops still fighting in the center and southern part of Kupyansk near impossible, as it gave Russian troops complete dominance over the road leading to the city along the Oskil River.
